>Anybody read anything applicable to 'optimized neural network calculation'?
>Maybe have some suggestions on things to read up on?  :)

What you need here is probably a specializer or partial evaluator, which
takes the source to a function and optimizes it based on the knowledge that
one or more of the parameters will always have the same value. One good free
one is cmix (not to be confused with the music language of the same name),
http://www.diku.dk/forskning/topps/activities/cmix/ which I've used on
various occasions.

Now, it true that a specializer will be unlikely to use the matrix
manipulations mentioned elsewhere to optimize the network, but given the
NEAT network evaluator and a particular network, it should be able to turn
it into much more optimal code.

(nb. One rather fun use of cmix is to use it on a high-level language
interpreter and turn it into a compiler.)

--Darren
